alert.note: Alert for Neshoba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 17 at 3:48PM CST until February 17 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CST FOR SOUTHERN NOXUBEE...KEMPER AND NORTHEASTERN NESHOBA COUNTIES... At 347 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bluff Springs, or 10 miles south of Preston, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... De Kalb around 400 PM CST. Paulette around 415 PM CST. Cooksville around 420 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Shuqualak and Scooba. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for east central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
